, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A further three firms\nare registered to a space in a Birmingham building, which is estimated to house\napproximately 1,300 firms. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Documents\nsupplied by Moldova\u2019s Ministry of Justice reveal one of these Birmingham firms\nwas awarded half a billion dollars in a single court decision.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to financial\nregulation experts and campaigners, Britain has long been a favored destination\nfor foreign fraudsters and criminals to hide their ill-gotten cash. Systemic\nfailures make it impossible to pursue the billions laundered directly into\nonshore British financial organizations.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money laundering is\nnecessitated by the requirement for criminals, be they drug traffickers,\norganized criminals, terrorists, arms traffickers, blackmailers, or credit card\nswindlers, to disguise the origin of their criminal money so that they can use\nit more easily. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money laundering\ngenerally involves a series of multiple transactions used to disguise the\nsource of financial assets so that those assets may be used without\ncompromising the criminals who are seeking to use the funds. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These transactions\ntypically fall into three stages: --<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) Placement, the\nprocess of placing, through deposits, wire transfers, or other means, unlawful\nproceeds into financial institutions; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) Layering, the\nprocess of separating the proceeds of criminal activity from their origin\nthrough the use of layers of complex financial transactions; and <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) Integration, the\nprocess of using an apparently legitimate transaction to disguise the illicit\nproceeds. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through this process\nthe criminal tries to transform the monetary proceeds derived from illicit\nactivities into funds with an apparently legal source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern financial\nsystems, in addition to facilitating legitimate commerce, permit criminals to\norder the transfer of millions of dollars instantly, using personal computers\nand satellite dishes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The criminal's choice\nof money laundering vehicles is limited only by his or her creativity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money is laundered\nthrough currency exchange houses, stock brokerage houses, gold dealers,\ncasinos, automobile dealerships, insurance companies, and trading companies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Private banking facilities, offshore banking, shell corporations, free trade\nzones, wire systems, and trade financing all have the ability to mask illegal\nactivities. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unchecked, money\nlaundering can erode the integrity of a nation's financial institutions. Due to\nthe high integration of capital markets, money laundering could also adversely\naffect currencies and interest rates as launderers reinvest funds where their\nschemes are less likely to be detected, rather than where rates of return are\nhigher.</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ultimately, this\nlaundered money flows into global financial systems where it could undermine\nnational economies and currencies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The continued abuse of some offshore financial\ncenters, the proliferation of on-line Internet banking and Internet gambling\nhave further enhanced the need to scrutinize new technologies to combat money\nlaundering schemes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.reuters.com/article/us-gambling-idUSTRE73E6HW20110415\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.reuters.com/article/us-gambling-idUSTRE73E6HW20110415</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To determine the\nresidential status of foreign companies, the Finance Act 2015 introduced the\nconcept of place of effective management or POEM. If a company\u2019s place of\neffective management is India, it will be treated as an Indian resident and its\nglobal income will be taxable in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My friend ARUN \u2013will it\ntake off by at least&nbsp; April 1, 2017 \u2013why\nthis delay. Why did demonetization happen before ? &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BATAOO NAH ?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The intent of POEM is\nto not target Indian multi-nationals which are engaged in business activity\noutside India. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the intent is to\ntarget shell companies created for retaining income outside India although real\ncontrol and management of affairs is located in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">FLIPKART KO LODA LAG\nJAYEGA KYA ?</span><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Passive income\ncompanies are usually of three types \u2013 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--- a large group that\nhas global subsidiaries and has been using intermediate holding companies that\nlack real operations;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- entities, such as in\nthe biotechnology and pharmaceutical sectors, that have companies outside India\nwith the sole purpose of owning intellectual property and thereby earn only\nlicensing or royalty income; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--- &nbsp;personal holding companies of Indian\nindividuals, especially in the private equity space.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fund managers, based in\nIndia, have holding companies in low-tax jurisdictions and that company owns\ninterest in a fund or other investments for them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These holding companies &nbsp;<b style=\"background-color: white;\">KO\nLODA LAG JAAN CHAAHIYE</b> -- &nbsp;they have no\nactive income and key decisions are taken in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Place of Effective\nManagement is defined in the Income Tax Act to mean \u201ca place where key\nmanagement and commercial decisions that are necessary for the conduct of the\nbusiness of an entity as a whole are, in substance, made.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A company will be\ndeemed to be engaged in active business outside India if the passive income is\nnot more than 50% of its total income and less than 50% of its total assets are\nsituated in India, less than 50% of the total number of employees are situated\nin India or are resident in India, and the payroll expenses on such employees\nis less than 50% of the total payroll expenditure. It attempts to differentiate\nbetween shareholder control, management control and routine decisions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The intent is not to\ntarget Indian multinationals which are engaged in business activity outside\nIndia, but to target shell companies and companies which are created for retaining\nincome outside India although real control and management of affairs is located\nin India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Head Office\u2019 of a\ncompany would be the place where the company's senior management and their\ndirect support staff are located or, if they are located at more than one\nlocation, the place where they are primarily or predominantly located.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Controls have been\nplaced over a tax assessing officer triggering these rules. He will need\napproval of a three-member collegium of his senior officers prior to invoking\nthese guidelines<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money launderers also\nnegatively impact jurisdictions by reducing tax revenues through underground\neconomies, competing unfairly with legitimate businesses, damaging financial\nsystems, and disrupting economic development.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Financial gain means power.\nFighting money launderers not only reduces financial crime; it also deprives\ncriminals and terrorists of the means to commit other serious crimes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The United States and\nother nations are victims of tax evasion schemes that use various financial\ncenters around the world and their bank secrecy laws to hide money from tax\nauthorities, thus undermining legitimate tax collection.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Financial centers that\nhave strong bank secrecy laws and weak corporate formation regulations, and\nthat do not cooperate in tax inquiries from foreign governments, are found\nworldwide.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These financial centers, known as \"tax havens,\" thrive in\nproviding sanctuary for the deposit of monies from individuals and businesses\nthat evade the payment of taxes in their home jurisdictions and allow them to\nkeep the money they have deposited from the knowledge of tax authorities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Billions of funds on which tax is properly due, denominated in various\ncurrencies, are held on deposit in these tax havens.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both tax evasion and\nmoney laundering are activities that are aided by financial centers that have\nstrong bank secrecy laws and a policy of non-cooperation with foreign law\nenforcement authorities, as is the case with some jurisdictions with offshore\nfinancial centers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearly sixty\njurisdictions, scattered around the globe, comprise the constantly expanding\noffshore financial services sector. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">offshore financial\ncenters are in almost all cases, segregated from the normal banking structure\nof the jurisdiction. The vast majority of jurisdictions offering offshore\nfinancial services restrict access to these services and products to\nnon-residents, thereby creating a parallel system within their own borders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many jurisdictions with OFCs conduct financial transactions only in currencies\nother than the local currency. OFCs lack the stringent regulatory and\nsupervisory regimes found in developed onshore jurisdictions. In the majority\nof OFCs, banks are not required to adhere to a wide range of regulations\nnormally imposed on onshore banks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Formation of a bank is\nmore easily accomplished in most OFCs; --- in some jurisdictions a bank can be\nformed, registered and its ownership placed in the hands of nominee directors\nvia the Internet.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However formed, there are few, if any, disclosure\nrequirements; bank transactions are free of exchange and interest rate\nrestrictions; minimal or no capital reserve requirements are required; and\ntransactions are mostly tax-free.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OFCs, a principal\nattraction is often the existence of legal frameworks designed to obscure the\nidentity of the beneficial owner, to promote regulatory and supervisory\narbitrage, and to provide mitigation or evasion of home-country tax regimes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of these OFCs offer the ability to form and manage confidentiality of a\nvariety of international business companies (IBCs) and exempt companies,\ntrusts, investment funds and insurance companies, many with nominee directors,\nnominee officeholders and nominee shareholders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When combined with the use of\nbearer shares and \"mini-trusts\" (the latter are instruments used to\nfurther insulate the beneficial owner while bridging the ownership and\nmanagement of the corporate entity), IBCs can present impenetrable barriers to\nlaw enforcement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;OFCs maintain that their carefully crafted\nlaws and regulations provide beneficial business and financial planning options\nfor their clients.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These include, but are not limited to: sophisticated trade\nfinancing; estate planning for high net worth individuals; tax mitigation for\nindividuals and corporations; avoidance of exchange controls; liability\ncontainment for ships and airplanes; sophisticated insurance management\noptions; investment opportunities that transcend home country marketing\nregulations; preservation of assets; investment of overnight funds; and freedom\nfrom certain home country regulatory requirements.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This lack of\ntransparency, coupled with a concomitant reluctance or refusal of many OFCs to\ncooperate with regulators and law enforcement officials from other\njurisdictions, attracts those with both legitimate and illegitimate purposes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drug traffickers, terrorists, money launderers, tax evaders and other criminals\nhave found the OFCs a particularly inviting venue in which to conduct and\nconceal their activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One form of trust, the\nAsset Protection Trust (APT), protects the assets of individuals from civil\njudgments in their home countries. A common provision of APTs is that\nchallenges or claims against the assets of the trust must be brought before the\ncourts of the jurisdiction of the APT domicile within a relatively short period\nof time (usually two years).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many APTs contain \"flee clauses\"\nproviding for funds to be immediately transferred to another OFC if the APT is\nthreatened by inquiry. Used in combination, IBCs, mini-trusts, bearer shares\nand APTs make it nearly impossible for competent authorities to generate paper\ntrails or to identify beneficial owners of companies, while they simultaneously\nprotect those engaging in serious financial crime from civil or criminal prosecution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Selling of\n\"economic citizenship\"\u2014a practice that enables individuals suspected\nof committing crimes to purchase citizenship in an OFC jurisdiction that does\nnot have an extradition agreement with the purchaser's original home country.\nCurrently five Caribbean Basin OFCs are actively selling economic citizenships:\nBelize, Dominica, Grenada, St. Kitts/Nevis and St. Vincent and the Grenadines.\nIn the Pacific region, economic citizenships are for sale in Nauru.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internet gaming\nexecuted via the use of credit cards and offshore banks represents yet another\npowerful vehicle for criminals to launder funds from illicit sources as well as\nto evade taxes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advertised on the Internet as being located primarily in the\nCaribbean Basin, virtual casinos can be extremely profitable for governments\nthat sell the licenses and likely share in the operator's profits. Antigua and\nBarbuda, for example, reportedly had licensed more than 80 Internet gaming\nwebsites at a cost of $75,000-$85,000 for a sports betting shop and $100,000\nfor a virtual casino.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the Offshore Financial Services chart indicates, with\nthe exception of St. Vincent and the Grenadines, all Caribbean Basin OFCs that\nsell \"economic citizenships\" also sell virtual casino licenses. In\nthe Pacific region, only the Palau and Vanuatu OFCs are reported to sell gaming\nlicenses (reportedly for much lower fees than are charged in the Caribbean)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the advent of the\nInternet and other technological advances, monies can be quickly transferred\naround the globe, providing further opportunities to engage in the placement\nand layering of illicitly gained funds.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Unlawful Internet Gambling\nEnforcement Act is an anti-gambling law that passed Congress on September 30,\n2006. It was signed into law by President George W. Bush on October 13, 2006.\nIt is often abbreviated as simply UIGEA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The UIGEA&nbsp; was a punitive measure that added a layer of\nenforcement against individuals and companies that processed payments for\nillegal internet gambling, which was not defined by the law.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bill stalled in the\nUS Senate. It was unable to gain traction on its own thanks to Bilderberg club<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The final version of\nthe bill was toned down from the original to please KOHSR big fisg. It was\nattached to the Safe Port Act of 2006, which was a funding bill to counter\nterrorism. It passed Congress&nbsp; on Sept.\n30, 2006-- to the outrage of Jews in&nbsp;\nAmerica. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gist of the bill is\nthis:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It \u201cprohibits gambling\nbusinesses from knowingly accepting payments in connection with the\nparticipation of another person in a bet or wager that involves the use of the\nInternet and that is unlawful under any federal or state law.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The UIGEA made it\nillegal for the following entities to facilitate payments in connection with\nonline gambling transactions: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(i) the operator (i.e.\nthe casino)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(ii) the payment\nprocessor<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(iii) the debit/credit\ncard issuer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(iv) any depository\ninstitution (read: BANK)...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Things were good before\nthe Bush Administration passed the Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act\nin 2006. Really good.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Players were signing up\nto publicly traded and privately owned poker sites in droves. Reports show that\nmore than 100,000 players were signing up to Party Poker, 888, Sportingbet and\nBwin \u2026each month. 87% of the entire market was US players.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the peak of the\nboom \u2013 around 2005, 2006 \u2013 online poker in the United States was worth more\nthan 1.3 billion USD annually.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After UIGEA was passed\nParty Poker\u2019s stock dropped 60% overnight. Other companies reported losses\nranging from $40 to $60 million annually. There was a total loss (market\ncapitalization loss) of (an estimated) $7.6 billion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The passage of UIGEA led all gambling sites\nlisted on the London Stock Exchange to discontinue accepting players from the\nUnited States. The case of partygaming, which ran the then-ubiquitous\npartypoker in the USA, illustrates the effect the Act had on companies that\nattempted to remain in the American market, as their publicly traded stock\ndropped almost 60% within 24 hours of the bill\u2019s passage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There were several\nexemptions for the UIGEA. This included activity protected by the Horseracing\nAct of 1978, certain forms of fantasy sports and intrastate gambling\nspecifically permitted under state laws. It also included language that\nexcluded forms of insurance and financial instruments traded on a public stock\nexchange.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The UIGEA\u2019s intent was to\nmake payment processing for these industries illegal. UIGEA created additional\npunishment for those found guilty of the activity. The goal was to encourage\noffshore gambling sites to exit the US market by creating a specific law to\npunish individuals and companies that processed payments to these entities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Online poker and casino players, as well as governments of countries and that\nspread online gambling to the US were among those that opposed the UIGEA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Financial Stability\nForum's Offshore Working Group and the Financial Action Task Force's\nNon-Cooperative Countries and Territories Initiative, have had a direct impact\non the offshore financial services industry. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These initiatives have\ndrawn distinctions between the better-regulated and cooperative jurisdictions\nand those that are not. Both initiatives have focused a great deal of attention\non the OFCs <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The principal objective\nof the Non-Cooperative Countries and Territories (NCCT) Initiative was to\nreduce the vulnerability of the financial system to money laundering by\nensuring that all financial centres adopt and implement measures for the\nprevention, detection and punishment of money laundering according to\ninternationally recognised standards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Financial Stability\nForum (FSF) was convened in 1999 at the request of the G-7 Finance Ministers to\npromote international financial stability through information exchange and\ninternational cooperation in financial supervision and surveillance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Financial Stability\nForum (FSF) was a group consisting of major national financial authorities such\nas finance ministries, central bankers, and international financial bodies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In response to the G-7\nFinance Ministers 1998 Birmingham Summit, the FATF formally created the Ad Hoc\nGroup on Non-Cooperative Countries and Territories (NCCT.) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FATF blacklist or\nOECD blacklist was the common shorthand description for the Financial Action\nTask Force list of \"Non-Cooperative Countries or Territories\" (NCCTs)\nissued since 2000, which it perceived to be non-cooperative in the global fight\nagainst money laundering and terrorist financing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recently the Reserve\nBank prohibited Indian entities from making direct investments in any entity\nlocated in 'non co-operative countries and territories', as identified by the\ninter-governmental body FATF.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Financial Action\nTask Force (FATF) currently comprises two regional organisations and 35 member\njurisdictions, including India, US, UK, China and the European Commission.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prohibition on\ninvestment is \"in order to align\" instructions under FEMA with the\nobjectives of the FATF.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money launderers are\nmodifying traditional techniques to take advantage of developments and\ntechnologies designed to streamline the process as well as employing the\nservices of professionals such as lawyers and accountants to help launder\nillicit proceeds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) continue to\nplay a critical role in U.S. anti-money laundering efforts. Similar types of\nreporting systems are in operation throughout the world and are a key component\nin global anti-money laundering efforts as well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to their\nimportance to law enforcement efforts to combat money laundering, SAR reporting\ncan also provide important information on current money laundering trends and\ntypologies. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">U.S. regulators tackle\nmoney laundering in the luxury home market<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seventy-eight percent\nof real estate transactions in the U.S. must comply with the Bank Secrecy Act\u2019s\n(BSA) strict anti-money laundering (AML) requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The real estate\nindustry is subject to BSA/AML requirements since the BSA\u2019s definition of \u201cfinancial\ninstitution\u201d includes those involved in real estate transactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A New York Times\ninvestigation found shell companies purchased nearly half of residential homes\nover $5 million in 2015.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The use of shell\ncompanies obscures the identity of the actual owner or owners, making it\ndifficult to determine the true owner of a property in a transaction, allowing\ncorrupt officials, drug traffickers and others to purchase luxury real estate\nwith cash.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of India\u2019s &nbsp;top wilful defaulters, Zoom Developers (P)\nLtd, and its promoter are linked to an offshore trust registered in the British\nVirgin Islands .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The company, which owes\nat least 26 state-owned banks close to Rs 3,002 crore, and promoter Vijay\nChoudhary are linked to Gold Harvest Trust, which was set up on August 23, 2006<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While Choudhary is\nnamed as the intermediary of the trust, Managecorp Limited is named as the\ntrustee.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The operation of the\ntrust were carried out from the registered office address of Zoom Developers in\nAndheri, which has since been attached by the consortium of lenders over\ndefault of loans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ED is investigating\nanother Liechtenstein-based trust set up by Zoom Developers called Beverin\nTrust, as it claims the trust was used to divert loan money. The enforcement\nagency has also provisionally attached 1,280 acres of land of Zoom worth Rs 1,000\ncrore in the United States under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoom had borrowed heavily\nciting projects in European countries. The money, allegedly, was siphoned off\nthrough many dummy firms - in India, Switzerland and London - and channelled to\ntrusts. Part of the money was used to buy properties. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now, Zoom has taken\ndown its website; e-mail accounts have been disabled; and telephone lines are\ndead. According to an Enforcement Directorate source, Choudhary is absconding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A CBI special court has\nissued a non-bailable warrant against Chaudhary who failed to appear before it\nin one of these cases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoom allegedly diverted\nloan funds to 350-odd subsidiaries, related parties based in India and abroad,\nand to purchase jewellery for the wife of its promoter Chaudhary. Several\nlenders also issued bank guarantees to the company allegedly without due\ndiligence and allowed it to roll over bank guarantees for four years until 2009<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoom Developers\u2019 main\nbusiness was scrapping a plant and then relocating it. In 2004-05, sources\nsaid, the company decided to use five aggregators, mostly from Europe, to get\ninternational orders. In this context, aggregators are entities that secure job\ncontracts for a third party.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoom used to sign\ncontracts with these aggregators to execute projects for third parties. The\naggregators would make advance payments to Zoom and secure this with a bank\nguarantee from an Indian bank for an equal amount.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These project contracts\ndid not have any clause on final payment of money to the company. Some\ncontracts allegedly did not have the name of the third party for which work was\nbeing commissioned or the location where work was to be executed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A classic black money\noperator opens many shell companies to route money before it is invested. This\nis called 'layering', and it helps in covering up the money trail. Assets are\nrarely in the beneficiary's name and money is moved through jurisdictions where\nIndian laws are not respected. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over the years, many\nsuch perfectly legal but complex financial systems have evolved that help\nconvert black money into white. Professional services firms located abroad,\nchartered accountants and savvy lawyers, all play a role in covering up the\ntracks, which perhaps no law - not even India's new antidote to black money,\nThe Black Money (Undisclosed Foreign Income and Assets) Imposition of Tax Act,\n2015 - can effectively counter or help unravel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">HOW DID NDTV LAUNDER\nMONEY ?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://m.dailyhunt.in/news/india/english/east+coast+daily+eng-epaper-eeastco/ndtv+director+exposes+how+they+laundered+black+money-newsid-61936401\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://m.dailyhunt.in/news/india/english/east+coast+daily+eng-epaper-eeastco/ndtv+director+exposes+how+they+laundered+black+money-newsid-61936401</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">########### SUBJECT---- <b style=\"background-color: white;\">GURMEHAR KAUR :&nbsp; LIES KARGIL MARTYR--- TRUTH KEJRIWAL\nPOODLE&nbsp;</b> #############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>KARGIL WAR ENDED IN JULY 1999\u2026\u2026.&nbsp; GURMEHAR KAURs FATHER DIED AFTER THE KARGIL\nWAR WAS OVER\u2026\u2026..&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">WELL MARTYRs DAUGHTER GURMEHAR KAUR HAS BECOME A DESH DROHI .\n..PAKISTAN DID NOT KILL HER FATHER, WAR WAGED BY BHARATMATA DID.... font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">COMMUNIST , MAOIST , NAXALITE MOVEMENTS IN\nINDIA EXHUMED VADAKAYIL ................................ capt ajit vadakayil ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 9, BELOW-</span></b></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wMebMiY5na8/WLWNiPX1KoI/AAAAAAABRSs/PnHsE1fTlkY7Qma9LZ3cCtZg3Rvx4GoegCLcB/s1600/20161222_120707_resized.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
